title: Better cross-referencing in changelog
body_html:
• Entries in CHANGELOG don't cross-reference earlier versions, e.g., https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/master/docs/Changelog.md#sub-7 even though their Operators.md counterparts do. This makes it hard to tell when reading the changelog if an operator is new, or if it was a modification of an earlier one.
  • It's hard to get a bird's eye view about all the operators in a new opset version. We should generate a ToC for it.
body_text:
Entries in CHANGELOG don't cross-reference earlier versions, e.g., https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/master/docs/Changelog.md#sub-7 even though their Operators.md counterparts do. This makes it hard to tell when reading the changelog if an operator is new, or if it was a modification of an earlier one.
It's hard to get a bird's eye view about all the operators in a new opset version. We should generate a ToC for it.
body:
- Entries in CHANGELOG don't cross-reference earlier versions, e.g., https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/master/docs/Changelog.md#sub-7 even though their Operators.md counterparts do. This makes it hard to tell when reading the changelog if an operator is new, or if it was a modification of an earlier one.
- It's hard to get a bird's eye view about all the operators in a new opset version. We should generate a ToC for it.
